positive.review: Adorable desktop companion that tracks keystrokes and mouse clicks. If you want there is an option to join a lobby and type together with other bongo cat enjoyers.

A truly low-effort reward game. Go about your day as Bongo Cat counts your taps. Gain  points, win prizes. Turn an innocent screen cat into a fashion victim with a variety of hats, fur styles, and lord knows what else. It's a "turn it on and forget it" game that's there for you when you could use a distraction.

I'm not feline this game. These devs have gato be kitten me right meow. This game is a CATastrophe I just PAWsed the game and stayed CATatonic.
Buuut there's an orange cat so it's purrrfect! :)

Have you ever wanted to have emotional support on your screen during your workday? Well Bongo Cat is a perfect option for this.  
I never thought that the Meowtiplayer update would change not only the game, but also myself.  
I found a lot of beautiful people here, we created a very kind community, and Iâ€™m happy that I downloaded this game. Thanks to all the Black Cat cult members who support my lobby and our little community!  
Totally recommend it to everyone!
Definitely game of the year for most relaxing and cozy. 10/10 love the artwork
The most important part is that we are all here together. It should win the award because it makes my cold heart abit warmer
bongo cat isnt just a gameâ€¦ its a lifestyle at this point :D such an adorable thing <3 if you need a game that heals your soul this is the one :)
It's fun watching my friends tap away with their cats, adorable low effort desktop companion that you can customize and meow with

They make it look so easy.. Bongoing with another cat. It's like no one ever told them it's the hardest thing in the world. 10/10 why do you need to look at reviews its game about cats just download it.

It's Cute, Stupid, Fun and Freeeeeeee!!!!!!!

It made typing emails today a lot more fun.

Bongo Cat has an extremely simple premise: type or click to earn points, trade points for cosmetics, repeat!  It doesn't sound like much, but it is surprisingly motivating! I have been doing work on products for my business that I had been avoiding for YEARS just to make my cat's number go up. I also love having my friends' cats on my screen with me! When someone joins the lobby for the day, everyone celebrates and meows and waves, and it makes me feel connected to my friends in a visual way that I don't get very often. Although, I consider Bongo Cat to be a productivity tool and not an actual game, it's free and fun, so I highly recommend it!

Cute little screen companion. Lots of hats and skins for your kitty, all completely free. And the game even has multiplayer - meowtiplayer - to tap your worries away together with your friends. All in all, perfect idle clicker for all cat lovers.

The only clicker/idler worth staying on your desktop
Like really, this kind of games usually just for farming items, but the dev then added seasonal events, then multiplayer, then emojis, then some more updates (and still going)... Literally the most well-maintained idler/clicker out there
It's a cute click counter and just love to use it on the side and it has cute ways to customize it.
its cute and fun also like the little beat that cat do.
This was pretty fun. Seeing my friends lil bongo cats on my screen as I worked was nice. I don't really play anymore after clicking a million times. Will bongo again when more achievements are added

I absolutely loved the Bongo Cat game! It is incredibly cute and instantly mood-boosting. The concept is super neat and works perfectly as a lighthearted desktop companion.

A big surprise was how much my colleagues loved it! They constantly asked what it was and gave me compliments on my desktop setup. The multiplayer feature is a great plus too!

just funny and easy to use

Itâ€™s a tiny cat that slaps bongos every time you touch your keyboard.
I installed it as a joke.
Now itâ€™s my emotional support percussionist

10/10: productivity increased, dignity decreased.

I just luv this game, i run it all time in the background when i am on my PC. The multiplayer option was the best feature that has been added. I found my fav lobby and love to hang around with all these beautiful cats (people) there. 
Props for the developers to make cooperations with other games or collaborate with animal shelters. <3
The skins you create are awesome. Great work!

Love my little desktop toe tappin' cat and all the accessories I can unlock. I also love when my friends get together in a party even if we're all doing our own thing since we can have some feeling of being together.
Good free game! You can play this game while you are playing other game or while you are working.

This game is great and I want to share "Easy Homemade Pancakes Recipe"

1.In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.

2.In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and melted butter.

3.Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. A few lumps are ok. If the batter is very thick, add milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, to loosen it slightly.

4.Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-low heat and brush lightly with butter or oil. Use a â…“-cup scoop to pour the batter into the skillet. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes per side, or until the pancakes are puffed, golden brown, and cooked through in the middle. Turn the heat to low as needed so that the middles cook through without burning the outsides.

5.Serve with maple syrup.

its bongo cat fun thing just to have on and just forget about it. THIS GAME BEST GAME TO JUST SIT AND RELAX TO! No for real very good to have in back round I have it on right now when updating my review.
its simple and dumb but it makes my second monitor more lively and i love the lobby feature. seeing the cats of my mates aswell is just the icing on the cake

I absolutely love bongo cat. It's so cute & so fun to play with friends. 
It's a great way to motivate me to get some work done as well. Sometimes I can unlock a new hat but don't have enough points to redeem it, so I will start replying to messages or finish work I had to do in order to reach it. 

This review was motivated by that exactly. Gimme the cute hats! 
Get bongo cat. It's the best thing. Brings so much joy!
Stands out in the clicker-idle-inventory-desktop-buddy genre in that it is actually cute and fairly unobtrusive. Has a lot of options and even multiplayer. Just don't try to collect everything.
Rwlly fun little desktop idler. It's super nice to see your friends typing away even if you're not speaking to them in this moment.
Super cute game! Love that you can dress up your cat and play with other people! an adorable distraction when needed! <3

[h1]sweet companion[/h1]

He is there when you work, when you code or when you play your favorite video game. Bongo Cat is a simple clicker game where there is a little cat on your screen. Everytime you click an your peripherals the Cat reacts and clicks with his little claws. Also it counts how often you have clicked and you can collect outifts and change the skin of your cat. Overall it is very simple and yet a lot of fun. It costs nothing so I can recommend this game to everyone who wants a little companion while sitting in front of your PC.

If youâ€™ve ever wished your computer had just a little more joy in it, Bongo Cat is basically the digital equivalent of sprinkling glitter on your workspace except itâ€™s soft, rhythmic, paw powered glitter.

I downloaded Bongo Cat just for fun but lowkey it turned out to be a super cool tool for coding sessions. As a dev I love how smooth and responsive it is. It gives this cute little visual every time I type and it honestly makes long coding hours way more chill.
Itâ€™s lightweight doesnâ€™t get in the way and somehow gives this cozy vibe while Iâ€™m working. Never thought a tiny animated cat would make my workflow better but here we are.
If youâ€™re a programmer or just type a lot you should totally try it itâ€™s way more fun and useful than it looks...

Just start the game a do other things, and collect skins and emojis, play with your friends (also in the background). You can run other Steam games while Bongo cat is running. I love collecting games, and this one just runs in the background, once in a while (every 30mins), just come and collect your price as long as you get 1000 clicks or keyboard stokes. Very relaxing and stress-free game.

Cute little background game that only records your clicks... 
Just a little cat where you do get to unlock random skins and accessories for... 
The multiplayer aspect is what I like the most, you can join your friends and their friends (or they can join you) and have dozens of little cats all over your monitor pawing their workload (or game time) away. Clicking on your cats makes it meows to the others and the cute little emotes can convey a short little emoji message to everyone.

Gotta love some rewards while suffering through writing term papers or enjoying some key smashing while gaming!
+ Cats
+ outfits for cats
+ let your cat be around your friends' cats
+ achievements
+ 'gambling' for new outfits
Funny little virtual friend. I like cats 10/10 meows.
i would and have recommended this game to other players! its such a cozy and cute kitty to have brighten up your screen! its fun being able to change up its style and now join lobbies with friend :D
Break the buttons on your keyboard or just have it on in the background as you write the next great novel. Getting to 10,000 clicks is easy... 1,000,000 a challenge.
Good game Super good gameplay Super story rich

A cute little idle game that rewards you with costumes, accessories and reactions. I have enjoyed the countless hours of watching my desktop compaining wack away when I am typing or carefully pawing the air as I play a more laid back game. The multiplayer features is really enjoyable and a wonder when you check your computer in the morning and see the screen littered with people who've managed to find your corner through friends of friends. Well worth the download and the small processing space it takes up.

This little cat is so adorable. Connecting with friends makes a really cute way to work together. It's free, which i love, and collecting fun items to customize my DeskCat isn't hard at all. It runs when playing games and overall is a nice little clicker friend!
It's a cute desktop companion that taps away on your screen while you tap on your iRL keyboard. Someone told me its a sussy logger app but I ain't buying it. We'll see how it goes..

Cute little companion cat with tons of customization. I change mine like every time I'm on. Controller support is a super sweet addition. Somehow almost at 500 hours already...that cat has gotta be getting tired playing those bongos.
bongo cat goes bongo, very great and i love all the cute designs

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ â€œPeak gaming. Truly.â€

I downloaded Bongo Cat expecting complex mechanics, deep story, and cutting-edge graphics.
What I got instead was a catâ€¦ tapping its little pawsâ€¦ every time I press a key.

And honestly?
Game of the Year.

The moment I realized that I wasnâ€™t playing the game â€” the cat was playing me â€” everything clicked.
Press a key? Cat taps.
Donâ€™t press a key? Cat judges you silently.
Miss a key? You disappoint a creature that isnâ€™t even real.

The gameplay loop is simple:

Press keys.

Cat taps.

Wonder how your life led you here.

Breathtaking.

Truly a masterpiece of minimalism. Shakespeare wishes he wrote something this profound.

Download it if you want to question your choices.
Download it if you want your friends to question your sanity.
10/10. Would tap again.
A top game for remote work - the kind that lets you jump into one lobby with your colleagues and actually feel you're not alone.

would bongo again.
Good game, variety of cats & accessories and just nice to do with friends having cats on the screen clicking and tapping away.
smooth gameplay while working - funny in full lobby with friends
Great idea, great execution! The reward chests sometimes glitch after the first opening of the day and don't give any rewards, but after a few days and an update it goes back to normal. <3

This is Totally... PAWsome! 
Tap Tap Taping with all the right Catitude!! 
SO many hats to collect to show off your cats Purr-sonality! 
AND it has Meowtiplayer.... What are you waiting fur? 
Get it and jump into a cat party with your furr-ends meow!

Love it, a very cute addition to the screen but not too much so that it's bothering me or cover contents. Better if there's some kind of in-game currency so we can return unwanted items and not just trade it, for instance I don't need emotes because I don't play in multiplayer.
Have fun with your cat. You can customize it and sell items at the market.
its a great game to have in the background i liked the items since they are cute

The cat just keeps bongingâ€¦ and somehow I canâ€™t stop smiling.
Simple, cute, and relaxing.
10/10 â€“ perfect for chill moments.

Cute cat, go tappy tappy, get cute items to dress or change cat.

Bongo your day away.

Cute little companion kitty! Makes you feel not so lonely when you can see your friends cats as well. The different outfits and emojis for the cats are very creative and fun - and it's wonderful how you can drag your cat, and your friends', wherever you want on the screen!
I think it could be cute if you could add sounds to your bongo whenever you hit it (click on your screen or type). Like maybe there could be 5 different sounds to choose from with, of course, the option to disable sound as well. ^w^ 


My only complaint is that the Danish "Meow meow" has been written as "Mjav Mjav" when I think it should rather have been "Miav Miav". Both words show up as being correct in the Danish dictionary but I feel like I typically see the "Miav" spelling more, compared to the latter.  I think it looks cuter and is more distinct from the Swedish and Norwegian "Mjau Mjau". But this is just a personal preference.
Cute and simple little desktop buddy. I love the multiplayer update so much, being able to see my friend's bongo cats tippy tapping is very satisfying.
its such a fun thing to leave on, the collector in me cant use my pc without it

good cats. causes some pc strain but that's expected with transparent applications like this really, usually more the result of driver or memory issues than the games themselves but they pronounce existing problems (tiny pasture and a few other desk pet things i've tried have all had a lot of the same behavior over many pcs i've owned). meowtiplayer is also genius and fantastic for a sort of online 'parallel play' when sleepy/not really down to actually game or vc but still Around and what i think a lot of other similar games/desk pets are missing.
Run it, and while youâ€™re gaming or doing your daily tasks, have a cute cat at the bottom of your monitor that waves at you every time you click.

Easy achievements, not much to it.
Just customize the cat and do what you want.

A fun little game, easy to get the last achievement if you're a writer and roleplayer who turns on the gaming/controller reader and plays any game with lots of clicking at the same time. I love the various outfits your cat can wear, although very sad some are so rare as to be impossible to get again now that population levels are up. Just like the Gaia Online economy, if you remember that. Except the Halos here are a sticky note that says "Stupid". I love seeing all my friends banging away in the taskbar. My only complaints are that sometimes it interferes with other games, or is a drag on my GPU. (And when constantly recorded, TERRIBLE, so turn that Steam function off for these kitties!!!) But they donate to charity, and help me stay on focus to work when I see my other friends parallell playing with me.

The story is phenomenal and the gameplay loop is seamless. The advanced moveset allows combos making recurrent players time more enjoyable. At some points I found myself attempting to pet the cat as the graphics are unmatched in realism.

I installed [i] Bongo Cat [/i] as a joke. Now I've clicked so much that my mouse has filed for workers' comp. I expected a cute clicker game, but what I got was a full-blown life commitment.

This game is deceptively simple: you click, the cat bonks the bongos, and your brain lights up like a lab rat discovering sugar. Every 30 minutes, you get to sacrifice 1000 hard-earned clicks for a â€œmystery item,â€ which is always either life-changing or absolute garbage - there is no in-between. It feels less like a game mechanic and more like a back-alley deal with a cat-shaped goblin. And then? You start again. And again. And again. A shimmering loop of tiny paws, distant bongos, and my mounting sense that I am no longer playing the gameâ€¦ the game is playing me. I donâ€™t know what eldritch rhythm this cat is tapping out, but I fear that if I ever stop clicking, reality itself might unravel.

My wrist hurts. My soul is gone. The bongos demand more.
Neat (and cute) idle game that doesn't require much micro-managing.
good game tho, u should try this so u can count clicks from keyboard and mouse

A fun little buddy to keep you company as you use your computer anyway! I love all of the different customization options, and the fact that you can earn them as you play. It's also fun to have your friends' cats also tapping along on the bottom of your screen (or wherever you decide to drag them to, lol). It's cute and doesn't make you feel so alone. The kitty taps when you type, it taps when you click, you can even set it to respond to a game controller so you wrack up points as you play. It's fun, entertaining, and a cute little companion on the long, lonely days. Go BONGO CAT! /á  â—œğ–¥¦ â— ãƒ

great time! i love the multiplayer feature so you can see what your friends are up to. it's fun when you're playing another game together because you can see when they stop to type in chat because of the way their kitty starts typing away lolll

Highly recommended! This cute key logger is an absolute banger. I have my Bongo Car on my screen whenever I'm doing pixel art, gaming, or general work. The skin and hat options are vast and awesome, especially the unique event cosmetics.but  getting  a  Legendary cosmetic from a chest feels impossible , its still an amazing thing  to have running on ur screen.
I have platinum'd the game and it is super fun. Now my goal is to speedrun it.
straight up bongo-ing it and by it lets just sat my cat

I love cats so much. This game is super cute and it makes me happy when I look at it. I get excited when I unlock new things for my cat. It keeps my fingers active and it's a great way to stay in shape.

Its not quite a game, but definitely one of the best free things on steam. I have it open whenever my computers on and its simply just peak. Sometimes when I'm playing a game it might bug out a little but its an easy fix. Also everything is well designed and there is a wide variety of customization options. Definitely worth trying it out.
Simple and cute. I love being able to join friends and see their cats too!
I have 4,400 hours of gameplay and that is Peak entertainment. 10/10
Absolutely delightful to see a little guy in the corner of my eye and let it not have eight legs for once in my life.
Addicting and cute bongo cats! I love keeping it at the corner of my screen while I do other things
this game is so peak and also fun to have running in the background while you do other things.
This "game" is the most idle, down to  earth game you can play. Bongo cat is so adorable T.T
Really simplistic but still really nice to have it run in the background when I do other things

Phenomenal. Outstanding. A testament to our times. Never had so much fun ever before in my life. May the gods bless these developers with unimaginable wealth in all its forms.

All hail the Bongo Cat.

Amen.

pretty unfortunate that it doesn't work when running a few games like Hoyoverse stuff & when playing GTA Online it technically works in the background but I can't get it to appear in the foreground, but it's still just a pretty neat little thing to have by your side. still prefer shimejis though ngl

Its idle fun & free too!
Can be a bit glitchy, but easily fixed with F1 & F8 buttons (see the settings menu).
It has multiplayer now =D

Amazing game i hit 1mil today and it was a great journey. I felt that the game gave me something to have watching me play games and i only spent like 10-15 bucks on it so it is great for people who want to buy stuff AND people who don't with the every 30min chest. So just download it, It's grrrreeattt! <3

I started playing for the achievements, but Bongo Cat is such a cutie that I can't imagine saying goodbye once I've completed 1 million taps. It's been so fun collecting cosmetics, and having other friend's cats sit with me on my desktop while I do work or play video games. I can't recommend this little guy enough!
it's a cute & funny looking clicker game, i would recommend this game to people who like repetitive things & overall the meme Bongo Cat

Bongo Cat is one of those little gems on Steam that doesnâ€™t try too hardâ€”itâ€™s just pure fun. Instead of grinding levels or chasing achievements, you get this adorable white cat chilling on your screen, tapping along like itâ€™s playing bongos while you type or click. Itâ€™s silly, lighthearted, and honestly kind of addictive once you start unlocking hats and customizing your furry buddy. Perfect if you just want something cute to brighten up your day without any stress.
Love this game, great way to hang out while you work. Cute little items to be earned. The perfect idle game to have on and non verbally communicate with friends.

Bongo Cat is definitely a purr-fect addition to my collection I love having bongo cat open whenever I can, its one of the best clickers out nyaow, dressing up bongo cat is honestly always a highlight of my day and then theres so so so meowny different presets you can set I actually love it so meowtch. my cool demon bongo cat taping in the corner is just so cute

Bongo Cat is the emotional support animal I didnâ€™t know I needed.
I installed it â€œjust to see,â€ and now this tiny creature judges my typing speed harder than any teacher I ever had. Every key I press makes the cat go bop bop, which somehow makes even doomscrolling feel productive.

Gameplay? None. Plot? Absolutely not.
But the vibes? 10/10.
My only complaint is that the cat works harder than I do.

Such a simple concept that makes me immeasurably happy - it's adorable! I love that you can join your friends as well; even when you're not playing a game together, it's really cute seeing everyone's cats.
Fredrick Is almost always on with me, he's my little buddy, he also gets double taps through controllers.
Chill game with friends! 1million clicks is a real challenge, dont play!

10/10 - Game of the year

Finally, a game that rewards me for my endless clicking and typing.

This is such a nice little gem that has no reason, but is quite enjoyable for it, to be as engaging and as much of a social event what with it's lobby and seeing everyones little tippy taps with it.
5/5 would definitely recommend!
Best thing to have leaving in the background of your laptop as you type away. Plus its available in co-op, making it even cooler.

Really cute lil clicky cat you can have on the side, though for some reason playing hoyo games does not register any clicks? Lots of customization to unlock! I just wish you could preview them on your cat before unlocking or buying them. Still really cute to have, and your friends cats can join you too, so even if you're not hanging out you'll still know that they're writing hate messages online <3
Cute desktop companion, very fun watching my friends tap and spam emojis while we're both doing other activities in the background. 10/10 deserves sit back & relax game award of the year.
The customization with hats and accessories keeps it interesting, and itâ€™s surprisingly addictive for such a lighthearted idea.

negative.review: likely a crypto trojen. for such a simple game it slowed my pc a ton. also it forced itself into the autostart apps so it always booted when i restart my pc. would not recomend. will be asking steam to look into the code.

I like it but there needs to be a way to disable the steam server lost notification that pops up every min or so. I'm not using it as a social app. I have absolutely no use for the lobby or multiplayer functionality. I like to write as a hobby and use it as a cute word counter.
This thing has no reason to need to be ALWAYS ONLINE and because of this it makes me think there might be something fishy going on under the hood.

It's not a game.

Might be a keylogger or a mining thing, it also for some reason kept messing with my internet connection.

If after that you still wanna give it a try, you can't really do anything with it. You can't "play" it since it's not a game. There's no gameplay. It just animates every time you press something on your PC. And you occassionaly get a hat skin. The only purpose of it is to sell you "legendary" skins. The "multiplayer co-op" also does nothing except you see your friends who have the "game" turned on press keys on their PCs at the same time you are. I relegated it to my second monitor but it mostly was in the way of me pressing buttons on my spotify window, moreso after they introduced emotes in an update that would pop up when you'd bring your mouse close to the cat on your screen, which you're probably doing while trying to press something on that screen.

Why not watch a game record your keystrokes in real time! WOWEEE!Q!!A@W
Ignore that your game strokes are auto recognized so they can record what you are typing instead!
11/10! Would let spy again! 
If not now, it will later, even if he says never. The moment he sells his game your data is no longer just yours.
He collects your data for personal reasons currently. (This is how it starts.)
Spies state "Trust Me [atm]".
Steam needs to ban these NFT type "games" that exist solely to waste electricity and give people 3 cent steam drops. Valve makes money on it so they probably won't though.

As much as I like achievement hunting, PLEASE DO NOT INSTALL THIS GAME. Slowed my PC a lot, after a few days of playing both monitors began to went out every now and than. I can't say exactly what it is, trojan or not, just stay away from it. One "100% finished" game doesn't worth the price of destroyed PC.

Upd: and yeah, it turned out to be trojan from the game after all.
Its not bad and i kinda want it in the background, but it turns on controller mode if you have one attached...
Not enough cats, if you love cats, 100% DO NOT reccomend. Fix your game.

cute desktop friend but also it s kind of buggy? the chest pop up just won t go away sometimes and appears when i don t even have enough points 2 pick anything, there are more small but irritating bugs so i figured it s not worth having it on everyday or at all. stupid, meaningless.

It is good but it does not work on linux, we need it to work on linux, we can't keep using this microsoft trash OS! It gets worse every single day. 
I will flip the review to positive once it works on linux. :)

Also mild NFT warning... there's a lot of cat NFTs going around, but I guess at least this NFT game has a cute cat and it doesn't distract you so much.

Review is meant for linux users.
There is no linux or proton support. It does not work as intended and you have to run a finnicky python script to get it to even work halfway. The dev has expressed adding linux support so i'm keeping my fingers crossed for the future.
In the meantime, there is bongocat for wayland but it does not support the online or collecting of hats unfortunately.
This game is crazy ! This game can break not only your keyboard, but aslo your brain ...

horrible "game" drops fps, lags everything, makes my computer crash and makes every game laggy. Ok, maybe the game itself isnt that bad but everytime i go into a another game with bongo cat on my game drops about 70 fps for no reason? the second i close it my frames are back and i can play normally. Maybe this "game" isnt so bad because well the trading cards but every single other thing about this "game" is trash. 1/10 wouldnt recomend it

Poorly scripted. I'm not sure exactly what happened but this "game" somehow captured 100% of my inputs into it, meaning I could not click on anything else. I couldn't even control+alt+delete out of it because I couldn't click on any of the options. I ended up having to do a hard reset with REISUB in order to get out of it. Once again, not exactly sure how/why that happened, but NO game should make it that easy to accidentally softlock your computer.

[h1]PLEASE DO NOT INSTALL THIS GAME[/h1]
Slowed my PC, after a few days of playing. One of my Discord accounts had its password changed and someone tried to access three emails stored on my computer. I haven't downloaded anything strange from anywhere or clicked on any links, so this is very suspicious. I can't say exactly what it is, trojan or not, just stay away from it.

I would not recommend this game. This game is cute and fun, but that's where the positives end. after some update(idk which one) made the game really buggy. It randomly freezes and stops responding covering my screen in white (haha >:|) and then doesn't let me close it for like 2 minutes. and lastly there is no "hide" option really. the cat is always there. gotta say i love this but im giving it a thumbs down solely because the "deluxe advent calendar" is $15, they just be asking for too much for skins

Bongo Cat is a charming little desktop pal. I really enjoy the playful style, and its minimal features are exactly what make it fun.

But seeing the publisher submit this for The Steam Awards isâ€¦ strange, to say the least. It ends up feeling disrespectful to developers who spend years building full-scale games. Enjoy Bongo Cat for what it is, but treating it like an awards contender just cheapens the whole thing.

I want to like Bongo Cat so badly. It's cute to work alongside my friends during the day and see their lil cats tippy tapping... but this game is SO buggy it can't even fulfil it's basic features. Every day I run into issues being able to collect items from chests.

I guess it's still nice to work alongside friends? But the game doesn't work as intended.

I don't know if my app is bugged but practically ALL I get are the emotes that I don't even use. I thought, given that there are two chests, that one of them could be skins or headgear but nope! I only ever get emotes that i couldn't care less about. To make matters worse, I finally got one headgear and proceeded to only get that same piece two more times over days of play time.
To make matters worse, it is a HEADACHE to get the bongo cat to another screen. There is no drag and drop feature, but instead you need to hold shift+windows key+arrow direction to change screens and it will cause all of your monitors to freeze and glitch.
Would not recommend! You don't get the customization the game promises and the act of placing the bongo cat where you want it is a nightmare.

It seems that the lack of penalties for humanity needs improvement rather than attention to widespread rumors.

I don't know why but this little thing gives quite a hit to my performance. I know i'm on laptop, but if i can run ultrakill smoothly this thing should tank the performance while i'm playing freaking hotline miami, cookie clicker, whatever. It's not that big of a deal on higher specs i presume but the fact that a click counter can just lag your game like that is pretty bad. Also for some reason the cat started having an outline to itself, i don't know what's this about, but either way, it's just not really that good.
The biggest waste of money on my Steam account. Completely pointless and destroys your tapout speed  if you use a second monitor.

TLDR: i mean, naa. i legit give this a 20/100 and we all know games, memes, movies, and music get rated at least 110/100 for just having a a cat in them. I think one of the cats when i wasnt watching knocked 90 points off the rating

 I used something like this in the 1990s iirc , for about the same time. 5 minutes with an hour of idle. This one does even less than the 1990s ones and iirc this one had issues like not actually doing anything, or is it me who doesnt actually do anything; umm no. I can confirm i tell my boss I am constantly busy.  The cat didnt swipe my laptop off the table, didnt purr, or rub against me and when i was playing games or watching videos with flashy lights it wasnt chasing them like lazers. ALSO ! Also, no cats brandished a knife. yeah so, i wasnt promised that; but ive come to expect the knife part. I didnt even get bit or scratched tho! It was lacking and since im a true crazy cat person, i dont even have friends to test teh rest of this with (my rl male friends are dogs people and would say 20/100 is 1000 too much after refusing to download it)

More telling this isnt much of a cat simulator is it didnt look at me headcocked sideways unable to move for a minute at a time trying to figure out why I  downloaded this. *shrug*

Im glad to see so many of you enjoyed it tho, so dev im just recomending ideas for part 2. If you can make the cat knock my dell craptop off the desk in part 2, or in some DLC itll be a surefire winner everyone in every office and every Dell/Hp/Windows 10/11 owner will enjoy!
